hydros

Python library for Hydros21 or Decagon CDT-10 water level sensor.

Author(s): Colby Sawyer

Implementation Notes

Hardware: Hydros 21 Conductivity, Temperature, and Depth Sensor More Information

Software and Dependencies:

class esdn_sensing.hydros.Hydros(water_depth=0, temperature=0, conductivity=0)[source]

Driver for Hydros 12 or Decagon CDT-10 water level sensors

get_data(dec_factor=100)[source]

Collects data from the device attached to the SDI-12 USB external board

Args:

dec_factor (int, optional): Holds the decimal factor to be used for integer conversion. Defaults to 100.

Raises:

SensorError: Throws error if device is not found ValueError: Throws error if device readings are not properly formatted after parsing (invalid readings)

Returns:

bytearray: Packaged up data to be sent via LoRa driving code

test(dec_factor=100)[source]

Test that the device is connected and prints sample data

Args:

dec_factor (int, optional): Holds the decimal factor to be used for integer conversion. Defaults to 100.

Raises:

SensorError: Throws error if device is not found ValueError: Throws error if device readings are not properly formatted after parsing (invalid readings)

esdn_sensing.hydros.parse_reading(val)[source]

Takes string of values from sensor and parses them into String list

Args:

val (String): Unparsed string containing multiple reading from sensor ex. “0+40+24.4-140”

Returns:

[String]: Parsed list of strings each corresponding to a returned measurement ex. [“0”,”+40”,”+24.4”,”-140”]

opc

Python library for OPC-Nx (2-3) Air Quality Sensor.

Author(s): Colby Sawyer

Implementation Notes

Hardware: OPC-N3

Software and Dependencies: Utilizing py-opc-ng library based on work from Fargiolas@Github

class esdn_sensing.opc.OPC[source]

Driver class for OPC particulate sensors

get_data(sample_size=10, dec_factor=100)[source]

Collects data from the device attached via the sensor_run method

Args:

sample_size (int, optional): [Sample size (seconds) of collection]. Defaults to 10. dec_factor (int, optional): [Holds the decimal factor to be used for integer conversion]. Defaults to 100.

Returns:

[Bytearray]: [Packaged up data to be sent via LoRa driving code]

init(avg_pm1=0, avg_pm25=0, avg_pm10=0, temperature=0, humidity=0, laser_status=0)[source]

Initialize instance of sensor

Args:

avg_pm1 (int, optional): Average PM1. Defaults to 0. avg_pm25 (int, optional): Average PM2.5. Defaults to 0. avg_pm10 (int, optional): Average PM10. Defaults to 0. temperature (int, optional): Temperature. Defaults to 0. humidity (int, optional): Humidity. Defaults to 0. laser_status (int, optional): Laser Status Code. Defaults to 0.

test(sample_size=10, dec_factor=100)[source]

Test that the device is connected and prints sample data

Args:

sample_size (int, optional): [Sample size (seconds) of collection]. Defaults to 10. dec_factor (int, optional): [Holds the decimal factor to be used for integer conversion]. Defaults to 100.

esdn_sensing.opc.sensor_run(sample_size)[source]

Runs the sensor specific operations and collects/summarizes the data.

Args:

sample_size (int, mandatory): [Sample size (seconds) of collection]

Returns:

[int]: [Returns array of integers mapped to the corresponding values ([avg_pm1, avg_pm25,avg_pm10, temperature, humidity, laser_status])]

sen5x

Python library for Sensirion SEN5xAir Quality Sensor.

Author(s): Colby Sawyer

Implementation Notes

Hardware: Sensirion SEN-5x

Software and Dependencies: Utilizing Sensirion provided libraries. More Information

class esdn_sensing.sen5x.SEN5x(mc_1p0=0, mc_2p5=0, mc_4p0=0, mc_10p0=0, ambient_rh=0, ambient_t=0, voc_index=0)[source]

Driver class for SEN5x particulate sensors

get_data(sample_size=10, dec_factor=100)[source]

Collects data from SEN5x device

Args:

sample_size (int, optional): _description_. Defaults to 10. dec_factor (int, optional): _description_. Defaults to 100.

Raises:

SensorError: Raise error if sensor is unreachable

Returns:

bytearray : Packaged up data to be sent via LoRa driving code

test(sample_size=10, dec_factor=100)[source]

Test that the device is connected and prints sample data

Args:

sample_size (int, optional): _description_. Defaults to 10. dec_factor (int, optional): _description_. Defaults to 100.

Raises:

SensorError: Raise error if sensor is unreachable

esdn_sensing.sen5x.sensor_run(sample_size)[source]

Runs the sensor specific operations and collects/summarizes the data.

Args:

sample_size (int, mandatory): Sample size (seconds) of collection

Returns:

[int]: Returns array of integers mapped to the corresponding values ([avg_pm1, avg_pm25,avg_pm10, temperature, humidity, laser_status])

pm25

Python library for PM25 Air Quality Sensor.

Author(s): Colby Sawyer

Implementation Notes

Hardware: PMSA003I Air Quality More Information

Software and Dependencies:

class esdn_sensing.pm25.PM25(pm10_std=0, pm25_std=0, pm100_std=0, pm10_env=0, pm25_env=0, pm100_env=0, part_03um=0, part_05um=0, part_10um=0, part_25um=0, part_50um=0, part_100um=0)[source]

Driver class for PM 2.5 Sensor particulate sensors

get_data(sample_size=10, dec_factor=100)[source]

Collects data from PM2.5 Sensor and packages for transmission

Args:

sample_size (int, optional): Size of sample in seconds. Defaults to 10. dec_factor (int, optional): Holds the decimal factor to be used for integer conversion. Defaults to 100.

Raises:

SensorError: Raise error if sensor is unreachable

Returns:

bytearray : Packaged up data to be sent via LoRa driving code

test(sample_size=10, dec_factor=100)[source]

Test that the device is connected and prints sample data

Args:

sample_size (int, optional): Size of sample in seconds. Defaults to 10. dec_factor (int, optional): Holds the decimal factor to be used for integer conversion. Defaults to 100.

Raises:

SensorError: Raise error if sensor is unreachable

esdn_sensing.pm25.sensor_run(sample_size)[source]

Runs the sensor specific operations and collects/summarizes the data.

Args:

sample_size (int, mandatory): Sample size (seconds) of collection

Raises:

SensorError: Raises error if sensor is unreachable

Returns:

[float]: Returns library storing [“pm10 standard”, “pm25 standard”,”pm100 standard”,”pm10 env”,”pm25 env”,”pm100 env”,”particles 03um”,”particles 05um”,”particles 10um”,”particles 25um”,”particles 50um”,”particles 100um”]

break_beam

Python library for LTR-390 Visible Light Sensor

Author(s): Colby Sawyer

Implementation Notes

Hardware: Break Beam

Software and Dependencies:

class esdn_sensing.break_beam.BreakBeam[source]

Driver class for LTR 390 Light Sensor

get_data(sample_size=10, dec_factor=100)[source]

Collects data from the device attached via the sensor_run method

Args:

sample_size (int, mandatory): [Sample size (seconds) of collection] dec_factor (int, optional): [Holds the decimal factor to be used for integer conversion]. Defaults to 100.

Returns:

[Bytearray]: [Packaged up data to be sent via LoRa driving code]

init(broken=False, total_breaks=0)[source]

Initialize instance of sensor

Args:

uv (int, optional): Calculated UV value. Defaults to 0. ambient_light (int, optional): Measure ambient light level. Defaults to 0. uvi (int, optional): UV Index, based upon the rated sensitivity, of 1 UVI per 2300 counts at 18x gain factor and 20 bit-resolution (default). Defaults to 0. lux (int, optional): Calculated light value. Defaults to 0.

test(sample_size=10, dec_factor=1)[source]

Test that the device is connected and prints sample data

Args:

sample_size (int, mandatory): [Sample size (seconds) of collection] dec_factor (int, optional): [Holds the decimal factor to be used for integer conversion]. Defaults to 1.

esdn_sensing.break_beam.sensor_run(sample_size)[source]

Runs the sensor specific operations and collects/summarizes the data.

Args:

sample_size (int, mandatory): Sample size (seconds) of sample window

Returns:

[int]: [Returns array of integers mapped to the corresponding values ([broken, total_breaks)]

ltr303

Python library for LTR-303 Visible Light Sensor

Author(s): Colby Sawyer

Implementation Notes

Hardware: LTR-303

Software and Dependencies: Utilizing circuit python library based on work from `Adafruit <https://github.com/adafruit/Adafruit_CircuitPython_LTR329_LTR303/blob/main`_

class esdn_sensing.ltr303.LTR303[source]

Driver class for LTR Light Sensor

get_data(dec_factor=100)[source]

Collects data from the device attached via the sensor_run method

Args:

dec_factor (int, optional): [Holds the decimal factor to be used for integer conversion]. Defaults to 100.

Returns:

[Bytearray]: [Packaged up data to be sent via LoRa driving code]

init(visible_light=0, infrared_light=0)[source]

Initialize instance of sensor

Args:

visible_light (int, optional): Visible Light plus Infrared. Defaults to 0. infrared_light (int, optional): Infrared light. Defaults to 0.

test(dec_factor=100)[source]

Test that the device is connected and prints sample data

Args:

dec_factor (int, optional): [Holds the decimal factor to be used for integer conversion]. Defaults to 100.

esdn_sensing.ltr303.sensor_run()[source]

Runs the sensor specific operations and collects/summarizes the data.

Returns:

[int]: [Returns array of integers mapped to the corresponding values ([visible_light, infrared_light])]

init(uv=0, ambient_light=0, uvi=0, lux=0)[source]

Initialize instance of sensor

Args:

uv (int, optional): Calculated UV value. Defaults to 0. ambient_light (int, optional): Measure ambient light level. Defaults to 0. uvi (int, optional): UV Index, based upon the rated sensitivity, of 1 UVI per 2300 counts at 18x gain factor and 20 bit-resolution (default). Defaults to 0. lux (int, optional): Calculated light value. Defaults to 0.

Args:

long_deg (int, optional): Longitude Degrees. Defaults to 0. long_min (int, optional): Longitude Minutes. Defaults to 0. lat_def (int, optional): Latitude Degrees. Defaults to 0. lat_min (int, optional): Latitude Minutes. Defaults to 0. satellites (int, optional): Available Satellites count. Defaults to 0.

vl680x

Python library for VL6180x Time of Flight Distance Ranging Sensor

Author(s): Colby Sawyer

Implementation Notes

Hardware: Vl6180x ToF

Software and Dependencies: Utilizing circuit python library based on work from Adafruit

class esdn_sensing.vl6180x.VL6180x[source]

Driver class for VL6180X Time of Flight Distance Ranging Sensor

get_data(sample_size=10, dec_factor=100)[source]

Collects data from the device attached via the sensor_run method

Args:

dec_factor (int, optional): [Holds the decimal factor to be used for integer conversion]. Defaults to 100.

Returns:

[Bytearray]: [Packaged up data to be sent via LoRa driving code]

init(range_min=0, range_max=0, range_avg=0, lux_min=0, lux_max=0, lux_avg=0)[source]

Initialize instance of sensor

Args:

range_min (int, optional): Range (mm) minimum during sample window. Defaults to 0. range_max (int, optional): Range (mm) maximum during sample window. Defaults to 0. range_avg (int, optional): Range (mm) average during sample window. Defaults to 0. lux_min (int, optional): Lux minimum during sample window. Defaults to 0. lux_max (int, optional): Lux maximum during sample window. Defaults to 0. lux_avg (int, optional): Lux average during sample window. Defaults to 0.

test(sample_size=10, dec_factor=100)[source]

Test that the device is connected and prints sample data

Args:

dec_factor (int, optional): [Holds the decimal factor to be used for integer conversion]. Defaults to 100.

esdn_sensing.vl6180x.sensor_run(sample_size)[source]

Runs the sensor specific operations and collects/summarizes the data.

Args:

sample_size (int, mandatory): The number of seconds that the sensor will sample

Returns:

[int]: [Returns array of integers mapped to the corresponding values ([range_min, range_max, range_avg, lux_min, lux_max, lux_avg])]
